en: 1850 Mar. 14, Washington [City, D. C.] [to Adam Fergusson] / Andrew Ewing

This is a letter from Andrew Ewing dated March 14, 1850. It is probably to Adam Fergusson. Ewing writes about pension claims and a decision by Mr. Edwards and Mr. Legare about them. He also mentions that the slavery question has not yet been resolved.

none: 1850 Mar. 14, Washington [City, D. C.] [to Adam Fergusson] / Andrew Ewing : page 1

body.value: Washington March 14 1850 Dear Sir Your last letter enclosing certificate of Clerk of Court as to his search and inability to find license bond of Mr & Mrs Kendricks with accompanying letter was duly received and the Papers immediately enclosed to Mr Edwards with my request for prompt action to which he has not yet answered I received last night from Mr Edwards the enclosed letter and copy of Pension Laws with his decision as to the application of the Heirs of Mrs Brent . as the Pension Laws were too bulky to be forwarded to you I have extracted the opinion of Mr Legare referred to in the Letter of Mr E Edwards and enclosed it to you with his letter I am sorry for his decision. but it cannot be prevented â€” No prospect of any settlement of slavery question as yet You hear much of compromise. but all is yet dark and dangerous Yrs Yours Respectfully Andrew Ewing
